revised_title: Immunogold Study of Transmission-Blocking Antigens in Plasmodium Berghei
tldr: This study investigates the expression of a 21 kDa transmission-blocking determinant on the malarial parasite Plasmodium berghei using the immunogold method. The determinant is found to be expressed exclusively on the macrogamete, zygote, ookinete, and oocyst stages. The antigen is distributed evenly over the entire surface of the zygote and ookinete but is readily shed from the parasite surface. The study emphasizes the general applicability of the silver-enhanced immunogold method in parasitological research.
